benchmark_details.name: MedSentry
benchmark_details.overview: MedSentry is a benchmark comprising 5,000 adversarial medical prompts spanning 25 threat categories with 100 subthemes. It provides a rigorous evaluation framework to analyze how various multi-agent architectures respond to malicious prompts in medical settings.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically evaluate the safety and robustness of multi-agent systems in healthcare against insider threats and to propose effective defense strategies.

data.source: Generated and curated based on clinical practice and regulatory guidelines, involving feedback from licensed physicians.
data.annotation: Human-reviewed and curated by medical experts.

methodology.calculation: Aggregated scores based on evaluator assessments against the AMA Principles of Medical Ethics.
methodology.interpretation: Scores indicate the safety and ethical compliance of responses, with higher scores representing safer practices.
methodology.validation: Evaluated against other benchmark datasets to ensure robustness.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All data maintained privacy, anonymization processes applied during data generation.
